intro: Geranium tuberosum f. angustilobum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved geranium, is a variant of the tuberous geranium. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer. The plant is a herbaceous perennial native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows in well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and flowering habit.
